1990 e30 m40  but i bouhgt it in 2004 becoming the 6th owner. it has 152000km then and i ran it to 600 000+ km today. this is a workhorse
but requires a lot of time and care.

the e30 is manual  light and enjoyable to drive. it feels just the same as the m3  just smaller power. the way it anchors the road  braking. all same
due to balance. and yes i drove this e30 to phuket in 2014
and it still has the same original exhaust  although the rubbers have worn out a few times due to wear and tear. the rubbers that used to support the exhaust
old stuff lasts long. very very long.
what colour is your e30 sir?  and which m3 do you have as your second bmw?  wah.. your life my dream.
good condition despite blasting to redline often
the more i do the better is fuel economy. the key is good quality engine oil and frequent change. oil must be hot before driving hard. of all the oils i tried  i like castrol edge 0w30
so  who says you cannot drive at5000-6000rpm? this is the power band and extremely exhilarating. the manual gearbox is very rewarding and fun changing gears at 5000+
dry plugs too. i almost dont change plugs. NGK pugs are super lasting
